subject: Collaboration Opportunity with Xander Racing
description_text:
Hello Simsonn Team,

My name is Alessandro and I run *Xander Racing*, a YouTube channel focused
entirely on sim racing, driving simulators, and sim hardware.

The channel counts *33,000+ subscribers and over 8 million views*, with a
highly targeted audience mainly based in Italy. My followers are deeply
interested in high-quality sim racing equipment, from pedals to steering
wheels and complete simulator setups.

I’m reaching out because I believe Simsonn products would be a great fit
for my channel and community. In particular, I would love to feature
products such as the *Simsonn Pedal Pro X Ultra* and/or the *Simsonn GT2
Racing Simulator Steering Wheel S1*, showcasing them through dedicated
videos and real gameplay use, with honest and experience-based feedback.

My goal is always to create content that is informative, authentic, and
useful for sim racers who are considering upgrading their setups, while
offering brands meaningful and credible exposure. I’ve previously worked
with companies such as *Simagic, Conspit, Pimax, HTC Vive, PXN, MOZA,
Fanatec and Next Level Racing*, focusing on long-term, mutually beneficial
collaborations.

I’d be happy to discuss possible ways to work together.

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,

Alessandro Petruio

conversations.body_text: Hi Alessandro Petruio,  Do you have any suggested collaboration methods?

Hi,

Thank you for your reply.

Yes, of course. A collaboration format that works particularly well with my
channel is a *dedicated YouTube video* focused on hands-on usage of your
products.The video would include real gameplay, setup impressions, and an
honest, experience-based review from a sim racer’s perspective.

My audience is made up of highly engaged sim racing enthusiasts, many of
whom actively invest in hardware upgrades and follow the channel
specifically to discover and evaluate new sim racing products. For this
reason, the visibility would be extremely targeted and relevant for a brand
like Simsonn.

Alongside the YouTube video, I would also include a *short-form vertical
review *(60–90 seconds) published as a Reel/Short/TikTok. This format
usually performs very well in terms of reach and engagement, helping to
amplify the exposure beyond the long-form video while still reaching a very
sim racing–focused audience.

This combination allows for both in-depth product presentation and fast,
high-impact visibility within a very niche and passionate sim racing
community.

I’m happy to discuss product selection, timing, and any specific goals you
may have.

Best regards,
